授業目的: The purpose of this course is for students to learn the basics of Canadian government and political issues that will shape the future for young people in Canada and Japan.
到達目標:
Students will:
• Understand the basics of government including parliamentary democracy
• Discuss current political issues: the COVID-19 pandemic; climate change and climate action; social equality; the status of women; immigration, diversity and inclusion; the rights of Indigenous (First) Canadians; sexual orientation; sex work.
• Learn how to create and present short “briefing notes” on current political issues.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: Learning activities include lectures by the professor, student discussions, and short student presentations.

評価.成績評価Grading2:
備考　Note
Students will write two short (1000–1200 words) “briefing notes” on topics covered in the course. A briefing note gives the reader a basic understanding of a topic (e.g., climate change) and what governments are doing about it (e.g., reducing the use of “dirty” fuels such as coal). Sources can include media reports and other credible on-line sources (e.g., the United Nations Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change). Each student will also do a short (5-10 minute) in-class presentation on a topic covered in the course; a presentation can be on the same topic covered in a student’s written briefing note. Students will receive marks for attendance and participation.
Briefing Note 1 20%
Briefing Note 2 30%
In-Class Presentation 30%
Attendance & Participation 20%
